Class Date

java.lang.Object
Date
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Date>
public class Date extends Object implements Comparable<Date>
Represents a particular date containing a day, month and year.
Author:
Seifeldeen Mohamed

      public static Date parseDate(String dateStr)
      Parse a date string in the format "month/day/year" and return a Date object.
      Parameters:
      dateStr - the date string to parse
      Returns:
      a Date object representing the parsed date
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the input is not in a valid format

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid()
      Check if the date is in a valid format (mm/dd/yyyy).
      Returns:
      true if the date is valid, false otherwise

      Returns:

    • isLeapYear

      private boolean isLeapYear(int year)
      Check if year is in leap year
      Parameters:
      year - the year to check
      Returns:
      True if leap year, false otherwise

    • getYearDifference

      private long getYearDifference(Calendar givenDate, Calendar endDate)
      Returns difference in years from two dates
      Parameters:
      givenDate - start date
      endDate - end date
      Returns:
      difference in years rounded down to the smallest year (how age works)

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(Date otherDate)
      Compare dates by their year then month then day
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable<Date>
      Parameters:
      otherDate - the date to be compared.
      Returns:
      int smaller than 0 if this date is before otherDate, greater than 0 if this date is after otherDate and 0 if they are equal after otherDate, and 0 if they are the same date

    • equals

      equals in class Object
      Parameters:

      Returns:
